comments.body: This doesn't save much. In this case you can work out the number of rows and columns for the caller no? I get that this is to parallel the method below, which also doesn't do that. It should be possible to at least work out the number of rows.

I'm not sure I follow what you mean by "doesn't save much". Could you elaborate?

From Python, you don't need to specify the number of rows / columns. They're 0 by default, which will cause `RowMatrix` to infer the dimensions.
OK the number of rows issue seems fine then. I see, the point is that this is already simple in Scala but not in Python. I think it could be reasonable then.
